spirit:addressBlock.spirit:name: some_register_map
spirit:addressBlock.spirit:description: This address map contains some example registers to show how RDL can be utilized in various situations.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CRYPTODISABLE13
spirit:field.spirit:description: crypto disable this field is used to disable the cryptography extension. 1 = disable 0 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFGEND15
spirit:field.spirit:description: ee bit config this field controls the state of the ee bit in the cp15 system control register. 0 = ee bit is low 1 = ee bit is high

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFGTE17
spirit:field.spirit:description: processor out-of-reset exception handling state 0 = arm 1 = thumb

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP15SDISABLE19
spirit:field.spirit:description: cp15 coprocessor register non-secure write disable 1 = attempts to write to cp15 secure-state registers will result in an undefined instruction exception 0 = writes to cp15 secure-state registers are allowed and will not result in an undefined instruction exception

spirit:field.spirit:name: DBGL1RSTDISABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: debug only: disable l1 cache reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: EVENTO_PENDDING_COUNT_CLR
spirit:field.spirit:description: evento pending count clear 1=clear. need first write to 1, then write to 0 to clear

spirit:field.spirit:name: EVENTI_MASK_1
spirit:field.spirit:description: eventi mask bit1 1= mask. for x=0, it mask evento from cluster2; for x=1, it mask evento from cluster2; for x=2, it mask evento from cluster1;

spirit:field.spirit:name: EVENTI_MASK_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: eventi mask bit0 1= mask. for x=0, it mask evento from cluster1; for x=1, it mask evento from cluster0; for x=2, it mask evento from cluster0;

spirit:field.spirit:name: EVENT_OUT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: event sent to other cluster enable 1 = this cluster cpu execution of "sev" will wake up other cluster cpus which are in "wait for event" (wfe) state

spirit:field.spirit:name: ACINACTM
spirit:field.spirit:description: snoop interface control this field indicates whether snoop interface is active or is inactive and not participating in coherency. 0 = snoop interface is active 1 = snoop interface is inactive

spirit:register.spirit:name: CLUSTERx_CPU_SRAM_CTRL0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Cluster x CPU SRAM Control Registers

spirit:register.spirit:name: CLUSTERx_CPU_SRAM_CTRL1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Cluster x CPU SRAM Control Registers

spirit:register.spirit:name: CLUSTERx_CPU_SRAM_CTRL2
spirit:register.spirit:description: Cluster x CPU SRAM Control Registers

spirit:register.spirit:name: CLUSTERx_MP_SRAM_CTRL0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Cluster x MP SRAM Control Registers

spirit:register.spirit:name: CLUSTERx_MP_SRAM_CTRL1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Cluster x MP SRAM Control Registers

spirit:register.spirit:name: CLUSTERx_MP_SRAM_CTRL2
spirit:register.spirit:description: Cluster x MP SRAM Control Registers

spirit:field.spirit:name: SMPEN
spirit:field.spirit:description: smp status indicates whether a core is taking part in coherency. for cluster 0: bit [3] is used for core 3 bit [2] is used for core 2 bit [1] is used for core 1 bit [0] is used for core 0 for cluster 1: bit [3] is used for core 7 bit [2] is used for core 6 bit [1] is used for core 5 bit [0] is used for core 4

spirit:field.spirit:name: CRYPTODISABLE97
spirit:field.spirit:description: crypto disable this field is used to disable the cryptography extension. 1 = disable 0 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFGEND99
spirit:field.spirit:description: ee bit config this field controls the state of the ee bit in the cp15 system control register. 0 = ee bit is low 1 = ee bit is high

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFGTE101
spirit:field.spirit:description: processor out-of-reset exception handling state 0 = arm 1 = thumb

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP15SDISABLE103
spirit:field.spirit:description: cp15 coprocessor register non-secure write disable 1 = attempts to write to cp15 secure-state registers will result in an undefined instruction exception 0 = writes to cp15 secure-state registers are allowed and will not result in an undefined instruction exception

spirit:field.spirit:name: GIC500_SW_RSTN
spirit:field.spirit:description: gic500 sw reset 0=reset. usually used for gic500 ecc fatal

spirit:field.spirit:name: NSEI_TO_CPU_CORE_MASK
spirit:field.spirit:description: gic500 ecc fatal caused nsei to cpu core mask, there're 10 cpu cores, each cpu core use 1 bit 1=mask

spirit:field.spirit:name: GIC500_ECC_FATAL_INT_STATUS
spirit:field.spirit:description: gic500 ecc fatal interrupt status 1=gic500 ecc fatal interrupt valid

spirit:field.spirit:name: GIC500_ECC_FATAL_INT_CLR
spirit:field.spirit:description: gic500 ecc fatal interrupt clear 1=clear the nsei and ecc fatal status interrupt. this bit will automatically restore to 0 after write to 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: GIC500_ECC_FATAL_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: gic500 ecc fatal interrupt enable 1=enable the interrupt. if gic500 send out ecc_fatal=1, the gic500 will be hw reset, and the cpu cores will receive nsei interrupt

spirit:field.spirit:name: CCI_CLKOFF_TIMER
spirit:field.spirit:description: cci dynamic clock gate timer. when dynamic lcock gate enable, cci clock will off after cci_clkoff_timer cycle.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CIU_CKG_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: dragon ciu dynamic gate enable 1=dynamic clock gate 0=clock is always on

spirit:field.spirit:name: CCI_CKG_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: cci clock dynamic gate enable 1=dynamic clock gate 0=clock is always on

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAIN_CKG_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: fabric 1x3 main clock dynamic gate enable 1=dynamic clock gate 0=clock is always on

spirit:field.spirit:name: ACLKM0_CKG_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: aclkm0 clock dynamic gate enable 1=dynamic clock gate 0=clock is always on

spirit:field.spirit:name: NFIQ_NIRQ_MASK_C2
spirit:field.spirit:description: cluster2 nfiq and nirq mask 1=mask. when giccdisable_c2=0, this bit must be always 1; when giccdisable_c2=1, this bit can be 0 or 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: NFIQ_NIRQ_MASK_C1
spirit:field.spirit:description: cluster1 nfiq and nirq mask 1=mask. when giccdisable_c1=0, this bit must be always 1; when giccdisable_c1=1, this bit can be 0 or 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: NFIQ_NIRQ_MASK_C0
spirit:field.spirit:description: cluster0 nfiq and nirq mask 1=mask. when giccdisable_c0=0, this bit must be always 1; when giccdisable_c0=1, this bit can be 0 or 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: GICCDISABLE_C2
spirit:field.spirit:description: cluster2 disable gic cpu interface 1=disable, this configuration only change to be valid at the time cpu cluster reset go to de-assert

spirit:field.spirit:name: GICCDISABLE_C1
spirit:field.spirit:description: cluster1 disable gic cpu interface 1=disable, this configuration only change to be valid at the time cpu cluster reset go to de-assert

spirit:field.spirit:name: GICCDISABLE_C0
spirit:field.spirit:description: cluster0 disable gic cpu interface 1=disable, this configuration only change to be valid at the time cpu cluster reset go to de-assert

spirit:field.spirit:name: CCI_GPU_FORCE_AWQOS
spirit:field.spirit:description: gpu force awqos to 0 in cci550 1=force to 0

spirit:field.spirit:name: CCI_GPU_FORCE_ARQOS
spirit:field.spirit:description: gpu force arqos to 0 in cci550 1=force to 0

spirit:field.spirit:name: DCI_DBGEN176
spirit:field.spirit:description: invasive debug enable. if high, enables the counting and export of pmu events.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DCI_SPIDEN177
spirit:field.spirit:description: secure invasive debug enable. if both spiden and dbgen are high, enables the counting of both non-secure and secure events.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DCI_NIDEN178
spirit:field.spirit:description: non-invasive debug enable. if high, the signal enables counting and export of pmu events.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DCI_SPNIDEN179
spirit:field.spirit:description: secure privileged non-invasive debug enable. if both spniden and niden are high, the signal enables counting of both nonsecure and secure events.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CRYPTODISABLE230
spirit:field.spirit:description: crypto disable this field is used to disable the cryptography extension. 1 = disable 0 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFGEND232
spirit:field.spirit:description: ee bit config this field controls the state of the ee bit in the cp15 system control register. 0 = ee bit is low 1 = ee bit is high

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFGTE234
spirit:field.spirit:description: processor out-of-reset exception handling state 0 = arm 1 = thumb

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP15SDISABLE236
spirit:field.spirit:description: cp15 coprocessor register non-secure write disable 1 = attempts to write to cp15 secure-state registers will result in an undefined instruction exception 0 = writes to cp15 secure-state registers are allowed and will not result in an undefined instruction exception

spirit:register.spirit:name: CPU_L2_LIGHT_SLEEP_CTRL
spirit:register.spirit:description: CPU L2 LIGHT SLEEP CONTROL Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: C2_L2_REPLRAM_LIGHT_SLEEP_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: cluster2 l2 replram light sleep disable

spirit:field.spirit:name: C2_L2_TAGRAM_LIGHT_SLEEP_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: cluster2 l2 tagram light sleep disable

spirit:field.spirit:name: C2_L2_DATARAM_LIGHT_SLEEP_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: cluster2 l2 dataram light sleep disable

spirit:field.spirit:name: C1_L2_VICTIMRAM_LIGHT_SLEEP_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: cluster1 l2 victimram light sleep disable

spirit:field.spirit:name: C1_L2_DATARAM_LIGHT_SLEEP_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: cluster1 l2 dataram light sleep disable

spirit:field.spirit:name: C0_L2_VICTIMRAM_LIGHT_SLEEP_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: cluster0 l2 victimram light sleep disable

spirit:field.spirit:name: C0_L2_DATARAM_LIGHT_SLEEP_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: cluster0 l2 dataram light sleep disable

spirit:field.spirit:name: DIS_SLOW_CLK_DURING_CLUSTER2_PWRUP
spirit:field.spirit:description: disable slow clock during cluter2 cpu core power up 1=aclkm0 and aclkm1 are free runing during cluster2 cpu core power up 0=aclkm0 and aclkm1 is gated for some time, or is slow clock instead during cpu core power up

spirit:field.spirit:name: DIS_SLOW_CLK_DURING_CLUSTER1_PWRUP
spirit:field.spirit:description: disable slow clock during cluter1 cpu core power up 1=aclkm0 and aclkm1 are free runing during cluster1 cpu core power up 0=aclkm0 and aclkm1 is gated for some time, or is slow clock instead during cpu core power up

spirit:field.spirit:name: DIS_SLOW_CLK_DURING_CLUSTER0_PWRUP
spirit:field.spirit:description: disable slow clock during cluter0 cpu core power up 1=aclkm0 and aclkm1 are free runing during cluster0 cpu core power up 0=aclkm0 and aclkm1 is gated for some time, or is slow clock instead during cpu core power up

spirit:register.spirit:name: CLUSTER0_ROM_READ_ADDR_REMAP
spirit:register.spirit:description: Cluster 0 ROM READ ADDR REMAP Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: CCI_M1_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable axi monitor for ddr controller p0 port

spirit:field.spirit:name: CCI_M1_CLKDIV
spirit:field.spirit:description: clk divide value of input axi clk

spirit:field.spirit:name: CCI_M1_READ
spirit:field.spirit:description: set to 1 to update reading monitor data, update every time when write 1 to this bit

spirit:field.spirit:name: CCI_M1_HB_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: set to 1 to select monitor data to bus

spirit:field.spirit:name: CCI_M1_X
spirit:field.spirit:description: cci_m1 monitor x_threshold for outstanding request number num_x_count => number of clocks that the outstanding request is > 1 and <= x threshold num_y_count => number of clocks that the outstanding request is > x and <= y threshold num_yplus_count => number of clocks that the outstanding request is > y threshold

spirit:field.spirit:name: CCI_M1_Y
spirit:field.spirit:description: cci_m1 monitor y_threshold for outstanding request number num_x_count => number of clocks that the outstanding request is > 1 and <= x threshold num_y_count => number of clocks that the outstanding request is > x and <= y threshold num_yplus_count => number of clocks that the outstanding request is > y threshold
